DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Local Palliative Radiation Therapy Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether of not patient received local palliative radiotherapy (e.g., small port) as determined for eligibility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Local Palliative Radiation Therapy Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures._Earlier in time or order._Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality._Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredName: Prior Local Palliative Radiation Therapy Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.:Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received local pa
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received local palliative radiotherapy (small port)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received local palliative XRT (small port)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient undergone any small port radiotherapy during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received local palliative radiation therapy (small port) within 2 weeks, craniospinal radiation therapy or greater than or equal to 50% radiation of pelvis within 6 months, or other substantial BM radiation within 6 weeks prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received local palliative radiation therapy (small port) within 2 weeks, craniospinal radiation therapy, radiation greater than or equal to 50% of the pelvis within 6 months, or substantial BM radiation within 6 weeks prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received local palliative radiation therapy within the last 14 days?

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
